description:
Honestly I had a great experience here and am confused about the extremely low two-star rating. 

I ordered the Tonkotsu Ramen and was actually pleasantly surprised because the broth was very flavorful and honestly just delicious. The meat tasted very fresh and was perfectly cooked as the texture was nice and soft - not chewy. The noodles were decent as well though not quite the quality of the broth and meat. I also ordered the chicken karaage which tasted pretty good though I would have preferred a more unique sauce than the barbeque sauce that was served. The service was nothing to complain about nor anything to admire. The restaurant was pretty packed when we arrived and though it took a little for them to get to our table, everything else went smoothly. 

Overall, if you are looking for a simple yet tasty bowl of ramen, I highly recommend this place. 

One thing to note however is that I am a fan of spicy ramen and though this restaurant did not take any special orders of that, I had to use chili powder instead; this worked quite nicely.
author: Abhisek D.

description:
But of course I got drawn into this tourist trap. I was wandering around Japan Center West by myself, I couldn't decide where to have to lunch and I picked Nande-Ya because of the old-style shrine-esque look with the lanterns. Seems peaceful enough from outside for a nice afternoon meal. Inside was bustling with servers running around, family overcrowding tables and I happened to be seated right in between everything because of the tight seating arrangement. I'm a committer, once I'm in, I have to bear through it to see what it's all about. 

Umeboshi Ochazuke- I just wanted something very light. This is a bowl of green tea over rice topped with pickled plum, nori seaweed, and Japanese rice cracker. Simple, quick and easy to eat if it wasn't for the scent of dirty rags they used to wipe down the table. 

Overall Service: Rushed from beginning to end even though they seem nice. I get it, table turnover must be great here, so they are trying to move people in and out but this place wasn't for me.
author: Rosie Q.

description:
Clint Eastwood movies are classics and came to mind.

You know, The Good, The Bad, and the Ugly!

 This restaurant brought back a lot of memories, especially in the '80's and '90's, when this part of this mall was the center of dining in Japantown.  With Isobune, Benihana, the taiyaki stand around the corner... there was an abundance of choices.  Now, the last man standing is Benihana while the rest are boarded up, closed, or under new management/ownership.   

Fast forward thirty years, it's a shadow of what longtime locals remember.  This used to be my lunch buddy's and my udon spot in J-town where there was a line out the door and a sign up sheet determined how soon you'd be filling your stomach.  With another lunch spot not being open and learning the plaza's sushi institution closed for business, we decided to grab a quick lunch here.  After a short wait, we were seated in the center of the dining room just off the window.  After studying the menu which has a variety of choices, my friend ordered a bento box (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=8ac3Xp2nKdv4Xpmib5mR5A&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) while I tried their "ramen special" for $13.95, selecting pork belly udon soup (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=CAaSfmRU4ssLO0QHz2HOmA&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q).  In the '60's or '70's, our meals may have passed as acceptable Japanese cuisine; given the globalization of the world especially when it comes to food, this was extremely disappointing and could be likened to fast food.  There was nothing particularly wrong with my noodles or the pork belly; it just screamed okay.  My friend generously gave me most of her chicken which was just okay, a home ramen supplemental protein.  Given how the bar has risen (along with the prices for food these days), the standards here are not as high as they should be.

Service for our table was fine, but most customers around us had issues especially a mother with two children; apparently, they had a time constraint which the restaurant could not meet and, in serving the food, the mother asked the server to pack the food to go due to her schedule.  There was quite a bit of back and forth before the customers were able to leave.  This also made for an uncomfortable dining room since other diners like ourselves witnessed the whole experience.  Given the situation, it would have been nice if someone from management came to resolve the situation.  Food rates 2.5 stars with a minus half star for the atmosphere.
author: Mike C.

description: This spot is located in Japan town and isn't bad but isn't great. It's a just ok for me. Food is pretty good, they have a good lunch combo that I would recommend and you can try a few things. In comparison to what I've had before at other places, the portion size and quality could be a little more in respect to their prices. Prices are somewhat reasonable in comparison to what I've had. Not a must but will get the job done.
author: Jessi Lynne B.

description: Craved some curry katsu and found ourselves wanting to try one of these places in Japan town. There are definitely better Japanese restaurants with better katsu but we were not willing to wait. Probably not going back soon or ever. Very focused on the tourist factor.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Nande-Ya is one of many Japanese restaurants located in Japan Center within the Kintetsu Mall.

I ordered the Alaska Roll (salmon and avocado). The price was around $10 for 6 medium-sized pieces; overpriced for the average quality due to the sushi rice having a dry texture. There was a sufficient amount of salmon and avocado in each piece, but was overall quite lackluster in flavor quality.

Maybe it was the specific sushi roll I ordered or they're just not experts on the sushi they serve here. Yet, it's a convenient restaurant if you're browsing through Japan Center and need a lunch break from shopping.
author: Anna B.

description: I'm not sure why this place has such a bad rating but the unagi bowl was delicious. Large pieces of eel with enough sauce to mix in the rice. It's large enough for a small meal but won't be enough if you're really hungry.
author: Phi N.

description: Ewww. Roaches. A confluence of bad decisions lead me to this restaurant. Staff was rude, food was average or a bit below, and a roach ran across our table (pic uploaded). That's what I get for eating at a 2-star yelp spot where are the customers were clearly tourists.
author: Nick C.

description:
Nan de? Nande-ya.

Located in the plaza of Japantown, a pit stop was to be made for food ... fast. With long lines at the other eateries with pages of waitlisted people, Nande-ya was packed but moving people in and out. So Nande-ya it was for some quick sustenance. 

Decided to take advantage of the lunch special, which was a choice of two ala carte items for about $13. Which is a pretty good deal, since everything in the Bay Area is priced too damn high. Opted to share the curry and ramen set. The ramen was pretty decent, definitely better than typical Japanese food court ramen like Miyabe-tei. A simple bowl of tonkotsu broth with chewy ramen noodles, wakame, charshu, green onion and ginger. The curry was simple and expected, a comfort dish served with a side of pickled plum.

Super packed spot, close quarters. Fast service and food definitely did the job, as we were able to order, eat and be on our way. Definitely, not a memorable food pit stop ... but not a horrible one either.
author: Janet N.

description: My kids love their udon and soba noodles. Their sushi is just okay. Their calamari could be better. Once this restaurant was changed over to a new owner, I feel like the quality of the food went down.
author: Cynthia L.

description:
The tonkatsu ramen was pretty good, standard for ramen I think. I'm glad I added the soft boiled egg, because man that was good, cooked perfectly. 

We also had the Kizakura Coconuts Nigori, which was sweet and very tastt.
author: Bryan M.

description: Love the Roman here. Amazing. Different from Chinese open Raman restaurant. Both are great, but prefer Japanese Raman to Chinese cooking Raman.
author: Sorraya L.

description:
After wait for a while, they finally sat us, but we were sat on the table for 6 ppl while there were 8 of us. How is this gonna work? They finally move us to the bigger table with 8 seats.
The rice curry for lunch special did not come with meat, just rice and curry, although we could choose another item with it for $13,95, still too pricey.
The food was ok.
author: Maria S.

description:
This was the worst experience of ramen for me at Japantown. If you are walking by this restaurant please keep walking!! I wish I checked yelp before anything. I honestly didn't want to judge the restaurant because there were actually quite a few people here waiting in the morning for it to be opened. My girlfriend and I walked in about 11 am and were sat down 10 mins after and maybe they were a little short staffed but it looked like a zoo. 

I was actually reviewing the menu and it was kinda pricey. The waiter took forever for them to place our ordered and the sad part was they only got my girlfriends order.. There's two people, but you only placed an order for one ramen, nice lol. 

My girlfriend did the ramen and sushi roll combo and when the server brought it out she just dropped it on our table. The tray looked like it was about to fall down. Mine came out about 15 mins later. Both of them were too salty, too much pickled ginger! Our soup became red. Yeah red ramen everybody!!
author: Alex L.

description:
Came to Japantown before heading to a concert and my boyfriend and I decided to grab a bite to eat so we chose this place since we have never had it before. 

The menu does have quite a variety of food options, but there wasn't really much that caught my eye or made their menu seem very special to me. I really wanted to order the Ochazuke, but they said they didn't even have any on the menu for along time....so why put it on the menu? In the end I ordered the eel donburi which was okay. It really didn't taste that good in my mouth and the fish seemed okay, but not fresh. My boyfriend ended up ordering the Soba noodles and he said that the soba noodles just didn't taste fresh, nor did it have a good taste. If you added more seasoning or maybe let it sit in the broth more, then maybe it would have been better? Who knows, just a thought. 

I would have to say the downfall of this place too was that the service was slow here even though there were not many people here when I went. The people that worked there talked more to themselves than payed attention to the customers. 

In the end, I don't think I would come back here and try another place in Japantown.
author: Nadine Y.

description: As nice as they try to make the place more appealing by the cool displays in the windows, their food/service just isn't good. I really had checked Yelp but I was so hungry and this was the first place that caught my attention (mostly the displays in the window). The salmon didn't taste fresh at all but I still ate it all because I was hungry, just glad that I didn't get sick from it. At one point, one of the chefs walked around in the open holding cabbage or some sort of veggie in his bare hands which doesn't look sanitary... Also a waitress was walking around doing multiple tasks wearing the same pair of disposable gloves from bringing food out to cleaning the tables to grabbing clean napkins for customers.
author: Elizabeth L.

description:
Came to Japantown and didn't realize that most of the restaurants of the old days have since changed hands. Didn't matter, we still decided to give it a try and walked into Nande-ya which used to be home to Mifune. Upon checking into Yelp, I was none too pleased to find it at just 2 stars but we had already sat down.

Looking over the menu, there really wasn't much that caught my eye but eventually I decided on the Lunch Special menu which actually does apply every day of the week! I thought it was definitely a good deal and went with it.

I had the Tonkatsu Ramen with Ikura (Roe over rice) on the side. It came out on a tray together and piping hot too! I started with the ramen first. The ramen contained ample noodles and had a good amount of garnishes as well: scallions, pickled ginger, wood ear mushrooms and bamboo shoots. I only had 1 slice of char-siu in the bowl though, but it was a pretty hearty slice. The broth was decent, not too salty but definitely missing some of the rich pork bone flavor. Overall, it was an "okay" ramen experience. I actually thought my side of Ikura was much better. The rice was definitely Japanese rice and they gave a pretty generous amount of roe topped with seaweed. Each bite definitely provided that richness in flavor, marked by a certain combination of butteriness, saltiness, and sweetness. Umami overload. 

Overall a 3 star experience.

Why 2 stars then?

Though my experience was very average, everyone else at the table commented on the saltiness of their shoryu ramen. Now, listening to my parents complain about saltiness is nothing new, but when you can get my brother to comment as well, you've definitely gone off the deep end for salt. Additionally, the sushi we ordered had rice that was hard and falling apart. Fish was also flavorless, perhaps frozen? And this was more of an annoyance, but the soy sauce dispenser was also assembled improperly at our table, spilling soy sauce everywhere when you tried to dispense into the dipping dishes. A bit of quality control on even these small nuances can definitely go a long way in my opinion.
author: Elaine Y.

description: I was in a rush on trying to find some Japanese curry and I randomly chose this place to eat. The interior is small, cozy, but also expands into another room. The curry was kinda pricey I'll admit. So I split a lunch special with a tonkotsu ramen and a curry on the side with rice. The ramen was so-so, it wasn't bad, but it also want the best. The noodles were probably the best part. It was soft and chewy, the broth was aight. Aside from that, the curry was pretty plain and simple. No complications there. It was ok, could use much more flavor though. It was 13-15$ I believe for that lunch special. I'll probably go to another spot next time since there are so many to choose from.
author: Alex L.

description:
The service here is meh 
The food here is meh 
The cost here is meh 

Which is why it's the epitome of a 3 Star restaurant. Portions are pretty big but they also give you mostly rice. Prices are high but that's how much everything is these days in SF. It's not the best Japanese food but it's not the worse. Definitely avoid if you have other options but Japan town surprisingly does not have the best Japanese food! 

For similar quality food, you can also head over to Kui shin bo for slightly better prices.

While other restaurants can have lines up to 2-3 hours, nandeya will never be popular enough to ever have a wait. So you have the benefits of that =P
author: Annie Z.

description: If I could I'd give them -5! Everything about the "so called" restaurant is terrible and wrong! Nasty kitchen, short staffed and even those working couldn't care less. Food was served wrong. Mani course, then drinks, then soup! Wth!  We missed that They had duct taped the torn leather seats which ruined our pants !! This place needs to be closed, renovated and reopened as something else! Definitely new management needed ! Yikes! Even thinking about it makes me want to puke!
author: Ati S.

description: The place wasn't crowded when I went. They seated us right away. I ordered the Kitsune soba lunch special with sushi. The sushi was okay, not really the freshest, but decent. The soba was incredibly delicious and warm. The tofu was soaked in juices and very sweet. The lunch deal is worth the price. Would come again.
author: Monica D.

description:
It's a 3-4 stars. You get what you pay for as well as for being inside a crazy tourist spot. The extra star is for previous low star rating. It's not a 2! You want a super delicious japanese restaurant, then go to a classier more expensive one.

Dinner prices are not as expensive as majority japanese restaurant. The sashimi sizes are decent-to-bigger sizes as compared to other sushi places. The service was good. All the wait staff were pretty attentive. 

The menu caters to tourist, a little of everything (rice bowls, sushi, japanese curry, noodles, bento boxes....and even french fries!)

This is not my favorite restaurant. But this restaurant does not deserve a 2 rating.
author: Chaye U.

description: I am super disgusted and really shaken; feeling like I am itchy all over.  Just went to dinner w my daughter; waiting for hubs to be done from work.  Having a beer, relaxing as I feed her.  Something kept bugging my head.  Thought it was maybe a draft or a fly.   Scratching all over as I type this.  Something falls from my head as I was trying to swat whatever fly was bugging me.  And the thing lands on my lap, and I see it.   It's a fucking roach.  I am literally wanting to cry.
author: N L.

description:
The beef curry did not have beef, but I liked the level of spiciness. And the slice of plain hard boiled egg on the curry seemed out of place. 

The soba was thinner and warmer than most soba and did not have the right chewiness expected of this noodle. However, you can't go wrong with their tempura! It's the perfect crunch.
author: Shannon W.

description:
Nande-Ya is one of many Japanese restaurant located in the Japantown mall. They serve a variety of Japanese dishes, from sushi and rolls, to curry rice, hot and cold noodle options, and set meals. I came here with my friend for an early dinner (5pm); there was no line and we were seated immediately.

I got the Nande-ya special ($12.80 pre-tax) which came in a boat of half zaru-udon and zaru-soba, with some tempura pieces and the dipping sauce on the side. The noodles -- both the soba and udon -- were decent, fresh, and chewy, though I felt it was a very small portion for the price. The tempura was OK -- not the best I've had but still quite crisp and tasty. 

Overall it was a decent meal though I felt quite overpriced, though I guess it's acceptable because it's Japantown in San Francisco. Service was efficient though not particulary attentative.
author: Alvin W.

description: The quality of food and service have dramatically declined here since it changed from MiFune to Nande-Ya.  Will not come back.
author: M A.

description: I should have done my Yelp research before coming here with my parents. We actually come to Japantown and eat lunch from time to time and never had a really bad experience. My parents are picky and don't eat sashimi so these types of Japanese restaurants are perfect for easy dining for us. Unfortunately, the sushi's rice was hard and tasted old. The udon was actually decently good. The service here does need a lot of work as mentioned by other reviewers. We ordered rolls to share and we got the little soy sauce plates but no small plates to eat our sushi. My dad paid our bill with cash and they didn't ask and assume to keep the change. We had to ask for our change when no one came back after 10 minutes. Asked twice for a refill of our tea. Not to self don't go to the second/middle restaurant in the Japantown plaza.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Not sure why this place has such a low rating. But I used to come here any time I came to Jtown w my family. Not sure if it's under the same management or not though.

But anyways, love how they have a good amount of deals and combo meals. I got the "daimyo A" combo w soba and a small asahi. Salad was a bit small, but I don't think you're really supposed to fill up on salad anyways. Tempura was super tasty. Didn't really try the CA roll, just went straight for the noodles. Lol

Broth was really good. Kinda wish the noodles weren't as cooked, but that's just me. Definitely would get that combo the next time I decide to go back here. I got full really quickly, so I took a lot of it to go. Super worth it for 17$

Boyfriend got exact same thing I did and the total came out to 45$ Very reasonable for how much food we got. Glad to see this place is still open and doing well :)
author: Denise Y.

description: Large portions. Sweet people working here. We had the Katsu donburi. The food is tastey and fragrant.
author: Terese V.

description:
I love this place, don't know why the low yelp stars.  I was a regular before they changed the owners/restaurant but the food still tastes the same.  Only change I noticed was they closed off the bathroom that was in the back hallway.  

My go to dish is the oyako donburi and shrimp tempura.  I also like the udon, the broth is sooooo goood.
author: Alice E.

description:
The price for the lunch combo isn't bad. I chose ramen with miso soup plus free curry rice. Also, I ordered the Takoyaki as an appetizer because it was my first time eating them. 

If this is how Takoyaki taste in general, it is definitely not for me. I felt like there was too much flavor going on with the sauces on top and the filling of the inside. It didn't seem like a good combination of all those flavors. 

The ramen broth was kind of unappealing. The miso kind of tasted bitter. So I added the hot spices into my broth which help increase the flavor.  My rating for the ramen is 3/5.

The curry rice on the other hand wasn't bad. There was this nice mild flavor in the curry. There were tiny potatoes and peppers in it. It was excellent. 4/5
author: Kristi A.

description:
Wow, I'm not sure what caused the vendetta on Yelp, but the number of one-star reviews for this Japan Center place is a bit daunting, isn't it? Jamie W. and I didn't feel it was quite that bad, but maybe we were still in "La La Land" afterglow since we saw it at the Sundance Kabuki just before coming in here. We weren't exactly dancing among the stars because let's face it...that movie was a bit overrated. Regardless, we were hungry, so we decided to try this spot that was once Mifune, which never impressed me either. They were touting their $13.75 Lunch Special Menu good between 11AM and 5PM (photo: http://bit.ly/2n66r4N). Long lunch hour, I must say.

We were led to one of their tiny booths for two, same ones that were here in the Mifune days, which are the dining equivalent of those Tokyo sleeping tubes. Both of us decided to take advantage of the lunch special since we're cheapskates. Besides, movies aren't cheap anymore, especially with a big bag of popcorn and Diet Cokes. Jamie went for the Tonkotsu Ramen and Curry combo (photo: http://bit.ly/2nSAEIp), while I ordered the same ramen and the Unagi Don (photo: http://bit.ly/2mDo9AP). The curry looked like a half-serving, not surprising since it was part of a twofer, but the sauce was on the watery side even though the seasoning was pretty good.

There were bits of chicken, carrot and onion in the sauce, and a lot of rice to soak it all in. The abundant rice was also present in my Unagi Don and frankly not enough of the saucy barbecue eel to satisfy though there was a big lump of fresh ginger to compensate. Our verdict on the Tonkotsu Ramen was the same. Meh. Lots of noodles, but the broth was off and there were just a couple of slices of pork and a handful of corn kernels in that bowl (photo: http://bit.ly/2njsyGa). Good thing I ordered the $6.80 Potato Croquettes, which were nice and crispy even though they were absurdly overpriced (photo: http://bit.ly/2mDeyKh). A debacle? Nah, just nothing to shout about from the rooftops.

FOOD - 3 stars...mediocre to middling, non-committal ramen and a lot of rice
AMBIANCE - 3 stars...still looks and feels as squeezed as Mifne
SERVICE - 2 stars...agree it's a bit on the abrupt side
TOTAL - 3 stars...I can think of worse meals I've had in J-Town
author: Ed U.

description:
Being that it's Japantown, I thought they would have good Japanese food here but nope. This place is run by Asians that are probably non Japanese?! Servers were pretty rude? (Actually made I shouldn't say rude but were not attentive at all.) I ordered the katsu don, niku udon plus California roll and takoyaki. 

Katsu don was so dry but I ended almost finishing it because I was so hungry. The niku udon noodles weren't chewy. I think they overcooked the udon. California roll had too much rice outside, I had to take most of it off but you can't really eff up a California roll. The takoyaki taste like a takoyaki but I know I had better. The cashier didn't even look up at us when we said bye to her. Overall experience was just  bad.
author: Cindy X.

description:
Best thing is the ramen egg!

No, really. The ramen and pork smelled like urine. The service was inattentive, but the location was cute! 
Do NOT come to this place. Spend your hard earned cash elsewhere!
author: Paola C.

description:
Nande Ya located inside the plaza in Japantown is worth to visit. At least for its lunch special. For a price of $13 you get a good amount of decent food. Definitely a bang for my buck. The lunch special here let's you choose two items but it's not like a Bento Box thing. It's more like choosing two ala carte items. 

For example there is a one option for Soba, while you can also get an Unagi Don with that. They even have Sushi as one of the pairing option, which comes with 4-5 items of nigiri. Definitely a new concept for me as far as Japanese food lunch combo. 

We definitely feel that we eat more than the $13 worth :)
author: Keith M.

description:
We haven't been here in awhile back when it was called Mifune over 1 yr ago. Waitresses were friendly.  Got the lunch specials which was about $14. I tried the tonkotsu ramen with sushi. The fish was not that tender. I gave Hubby the evidence and tamagotchi pieces. The broth was good as well as the noodle. There was a slice of pork, bamboo shoots, fungus. They didn't serve you tea, only cold water. 
Hubby's tempura was OK. He also had the udon, I tried a stand of the udon. It was OK. The broth had a tad too much sugar. The place is OK. I wouldn't make a great effort to return.   
The next AM I had chills, muscle ache and felt sick while en route to work. I had to stay because there was stuff to do but went home before lunch.  A couple of Tylenols helped with the low grade temp 99-100. But by evening, the nausea persisted and I had a bad headache.  I didn't feel better until I threw up a few times.  Hubby says it was probably food poisoning and the only thing I had which he didn't was the raw fish sushi at lunch the day before.  If raw seafood isn't stored or handled properly, you can get really sick.
author: Ry T.

description: This place, is alright.. nothing to great about it.. we wanted to eat here cause... every-time we pass by, it's always busy. But to be honest, we had better. Plus the employees, weren't as attentive.. until after the fact we were almost finished with our food. That's when they became attentive... plus it's kinda dirty inside. .. I had pokie and he got the kimchi soup.. we've had better. Just disappointed. But the only good party was da soju (coconut).. and tofu, was ok also. We also had better ...
author: LeAza D.

description: It's hard to stand out with so much competition in this complex. The ramen was passable. The sushi could be fresher.
author: Jason L.

description: A solid 3 star rating. We tried the vegetarian ramen soup and did not regret it. Although we did not try the sushi , we recommend the ramen bowls.
author: Karen L.

description:
Honestly the curry from here wasn't THAT bad from what I remember. But this is about the Beef Shabu Tei and other dishes:
1.) It is precooked. Despite being seated at a booth with an electric stove setup.
2.) I was afraid that if I left the udon in the soup for too long it would dissolve and thicken the soup. It was incredibly mushy from the very beginning and I have had better udon that was previously frozen.
3.) I am confused as to why there is a tortilla under the tuna poke?  Am I supposed to make a burrito?  Big tuna portions though and taste wasn't all that bad considering. . .
author: Sam G.

description:
My friend recommended Nande-ya's since he likes their lunch special ramen and decent price. I ordered the lunch special $13.95+tax with tempura and curry on rice. While I would have preferred to eat ramen and tempura, the waitress said they were not combinable for the special (which allows you to pick one item from each section). Also, I ordered their hot sake which was ok but strongly tasted of alcohol. The tempura was crispy with 3 shrimp and 4 veggies, but could use more sauce on the side. However, I was disappointed by the size of the curry, as well as bits of ground beef instead of stewed beef. There were also potatoes but no carrots. This seemed pricey for cheaply made curry that was mostly soaked by rice. 

My friend ordered the lunch special with miso  ramen and sushi. His ramen could use more toppings. The sushi looked appetizing.

Overall, I'd recommend trying elsewhere for better quality for your bills.
author: Kristen F.

description: I had to put one star to be able to post this review. no star for this restaurant, rice were sooo hard you can throw and kill an elephant with it.  side salad was not edible at all, the lettuce were turned dark and wilted, terrible! Eel were like someone's leftovers, was dried and over cooked and the fried Calamari were extremely salty! But edible, I don't recommend this place to anyone.
author: Ann C.

description:
I should have read the reviews before eating here. This happens every time I let my food buddy select a place to eat. The food  was decent. Wasn't the best but filling. Best to eat here during lunch time which cost less instead of paying more during dinner. 
We got the seafood nabe tei and beef & unagi don. Would had been nice is the beef & unagi don had more unagi. I actually liked it more than my seafood nabe tei which tasted like udon you make at home. 
You get a very small glass when you ask for water. We finished our water very quickly and our server never returned to check up on us or refill our water. Service needs improvements. I'm not sure if I would want to come back.
author: Javier P.

description:
Nande-ya translated into Japanese as the Why-shop as in Why did we eat here?! It's pretty expensive and the quality of food isn't that great. The chicken karaage was average (needed some lemon or better dipping sauce), and while the noodles were alright, the ramen broth was underwhelming (mildly flavored water). The niku bowl had too much rice (like 3 cups!) with some bland beef.

The service was fine though. We were seated promptly, food came out fast, had a courteous server. The bathrooms were close by which is a plus. But the main reason for going to a restaurant for me is the food. There's plenty of other options; try a better rated one!
author: Melisa M.

description:
The food is great - I had the chirashi bowl with miso soup, and my mom had sukiyaki (which she said was the best she's had). 

Unfortunately, the restaurant is set up so you're packed like sardines - I could fully hear the conversations of the people next to me (hardly inches away), and I'm sure they could hear mine. It's very loud in there. It's probably not going to be a very pleasant experience unless you hit there on a random off hour.
author: Dan N.

description: First timer and probably the last time I will come here. Food is def cater to tourists. The experience was good until we got our food. The staff is really friendly so it was too bad. Food was mediocre, not too bad but not so good either.
author: Bobo G.

description: Very expensive just for meat, with now rice I got the chicken teriyaki. I was very disappointed spending almost $13 just for a small portion of meat with no rice. So average experience here.
author: Alicia S.

description:
Wow.  I used to come here every once in awhile when it was mifune.  Now, it's called nande-ya...under new ownership but pretty much offers the same menu.  I never try to judge a restaurant by their emptiness but I should've known.  I really wanted a bowl of udon and a donburi and I remembered that this spot used to offer that combo.  

Udon?  Ugh.  Like it was straight from a package.  Bland.  Tasteless.  Warm, not hot.  Terrible.  
Donburi?  Bland.  Tasteless.  Terrible.  

Sashimi?  Frozen.  Yes...FROZEN.  Nothing like a fish popsicle with your meal!

Service was non-existent and super slow.  Not interested in the food whatsoever.  No thanks!
author: Jen W.

description:
Pros: Attentive service and decent menu.  

Cons:  We came here because there were quite a few people inside.  Forgot to check yelp before we entered.  Everything was subpar.  We ordered a tuna poke bowl and while the proportion was large, the flavor was not good.  The tuna had a chewy texture and wasn't enjoyable at all.  The sauce overpowered the the dish.  Halfway through I had to switch meals with my husband.  He got the eel bowl and that was neither standout or poor, it was your average eel bowl.
author: Viv I.

description: Stopped here to try there lunch special and for $13.95 you get a good portion of food that is filling and flavorful. The service was quick and we got what we wanted. They have a nice medium sized menu that has something for everyone that is into Japanese food.
author: Shaneel R.

description: Not sure why this restaurant has low ratings. Went here with my friend for dinner and got tempura shrimp and vegetables with udon noodles. It was so good!
author: Kelly I.

description: We stopped here for lunch on our annual trip to Japantown. It was pretty good! I had the lunch special with teriyaki chicken and pot stickers and my husband had ramen (don't remember what kind).
author: Ashley R.

description:
The sashimi did not taste fresh
The rice was dry and hard
The zaru udon was bland 
The extra bowl I asked for came with bonus tomato paste on it

The tempura, however, was good 
But I had to ask them for the sauce.
author: Bon B.

description:
Ordered tonkotsu ramen and sushi lunch combo special ($14.95) and boy it was not good and we are happy we didn't order more.

Ramen: Too salty, pork was kinda disgusting, one piece of chewy meat :) One piece. A smallish, thick piece. Portion size was meh.

Sushi: 5 pieces of varied meats - salmon, tuna, yellowtail?, shrimp, tamago. I'm really not picky with sushi, but the rice was really crumbly compared to every other restaurant I've ever eaten at.

Service: Super meh...

Lesson learned: Check Yelp before sitting down at a restaurant. But at least we have an idea of how mediocre ramen and sushi can taste now and a new lowest bar was set.
author: Lilian C.

description:
Worst restaurant I have been in a long time, even with fairly low expectations.

I'm familiar with many restaurants in this mall in Japantown.  Some are better than others, but nothing is amazing - many places just provide comfort, average food for not too much $, which is totally fine.  I was OK to have simple mediocre dinner as long as I didn't have to wait that evening, and the reason I ended up going here instead of next door was that I saw Japanese food menus hanging around, which gave me a little hope.  Wrong.  I ordered soba salad, and my husband ordered a simple entrée (can't remember) and also Shumai to start with.  They don't bring our shumai until we are halfway through with our main dishes.  But wait.  Then when they do, they don't give us soy sauce dishes for the shumai.  So, I ask for them.  And wait.  Shumai dish doesn't come with Japanese yellow mustard, either.  So I ask.  The waitress looked confused and said, "....let me check if we have any."  No からしin a Japanese restaurant?　No からし yellow mustard for shumai is like no ketchup for fries.  Sure enough, she comes back with American mustard.  Unbelievable.  

We shake our heads and finish our food so that we can pay and get out.  And btw all the food is merely OK - substandard for certain, but thankfully it wasn't as awful as everything else.  The same waitress grabs the tray my soba salad plate is on, which had some sauce left, and tilts it so much that the sauce spills on to my lap.  

I couldn't believe I fell for the Japanese menu signs.  何年も経験した事がない程の、最低のレストランでした。最悪
author: Harue J.

description: This is the first time that I ordered the dragon roll and they served with me with California roll with unagi on the top and just on some pieces of the roll. Dont recommend
author: Cherry C.

description:
Very disappointed at this Japantown restaurant. They lost our order and only realized it when we brought it to their attention--no apology. In fact, they did not look our way after we asked them about the order. Very uncomfortable lunch. And the food quality was poor. I noticed that no table got all their orders at the same time. Lots of folks looking around for service.

Also disappointed at the condition of the complex. The restrooms could only be classified as crumbling and dirty, at best. It will be a while before we think about heading over there again.
author: Diane K.

description: I would say this is your typical "tourist trap" restaurant in Japantown. I don't remember this place being so bad in the past (last time I was here may have been over 10 years ago), but the prices are way high for what they serve and the rice was hard. A Japanese place should not serve hard rice.  I had the beef & eel combination bowl and the meat was very hard and dry.  A Japanese place should not mess up on something as simple as gyu-don.  Don't be fooled by the people waiting to be seated.  The service was fine though. But I feel the people preparing/cooking the food are not Japanese and the owner must never be there to oversee the quality of the food.  I regret choosing this place when my time in Japantown was limited.
author: Jason K.

description: The food is pretty good but I had a problem with the service. I ordered food from the lunch menu but the waitress messed up my order and I ended up paying about $25 instead of $13. Good places will fix the order, especially if they are at fault. This experience does not make me want to come back again, there is a plenty of sushi places out there.
author: Simona S.

description: Me and my boyfriend went here for lunch and it was scary when my boyfriend actually chew a small piece of broken plastic glass. His gums got damage that cause him toothache that's based on his dentist from the Xray his gum got tear from accidentally biting that piece. So no more it isn't safe anymore. They only apologize for what happened and just ask if my boyfriend want to other another food instead
author: CM A.

description:
This place is okay. Nothing distinct or special about the food.

I got the katsu curry and it was alright. Definitely not the best tonkatsu I've ever had but it was good.  The rice was cooked well and so was the katsu, but it could have used a bit more spice.

My friend got a tuna roll and veggie tempura. She said it was fine.

Service was great.  I don't know if people realize not all restaurants are like American ones where the servers are bugging you every 5 minutes. Our waitress took our order, brought our drinks, brought our food, and then left us be. However, it was quite obvious she was keeping an eye on us in case we called her over, which we did do once and she was not hard to find. She just wasn't breathing down our necks which I appreciate.

The restaurant itself looks very nice inside.
author: Adrienne T.

description: Not my best decision. Should've trusted other reviews. Food was bland and not tasty at all. But since we were hungry and waited a while for dinner plus it was right before our flight, we decided to eat here since it seemed less busy. I really wanted all my food experiences in San Fran to be amazing but this didn't help. Gave them an extra star for being super friendly and giving excellent service.
author: Pam M.

description:
Friendly service. Lots of delicious food. And they sale souvenir t-shirts. Benihana (
Across) wanted us to wait 20 minutes for a table in their empty restaurant. So we went here and was immediately seated.
author: Yvonne S.

description: Really bad, food is different from the photo in the menu, cold tofu doesn't come with any sauce, tuna poke has too much sauce which tastes sweet, ramen is really so so and the pork has a little fishy taste, overall, only the environment stopped me to rate it as 1 star
author: Mshen00 ..

description: The worst japanese restaurant in this city. First, the curry I ordered has 80% rice and 20%curry. I asked for more curry and what I hear is extra charge for extra curry. Fine. I ordered more curry. For my mother's hot stone soup dish, a piece of box was in the soup. I said that's it. Called for manager. She said she can't do anything but take the soup away. Or she can bring new soup. Hahahahahahahaha!!!! Clearly they don't care. I live in SF and will never be back.
author: Saie C.

description: The food here was way overpriced. We chose it since it was one of the first restaurants we saw coming into the center. We wish we had looked around but due to our sheer hunger we bit the bullet with this place. The food was subpar, definitely not worth the prices that they were charging. I got the ramen and roll combo and both pieces were nothing special. I had barely taken my last bite/put my chopsticks down when the waitress came straight away to clear the table and slap the check down. I would avoid this place and wish I could have gotten to chance to go elsewhere for a meal at Japantown.
author: Megan C.

description:
I didn't find this restaurant to provide a memorable experience.
.
Their $4.20 Edamame came out hot and lightly salted. 
.
Next, I had their $10.80 Dragon Roll, which if I read the menu was really a California Roll topped with Eel and Avocado. As a Dragon Roll it was a real disappointment.
.
At $15.80 the Seafood Nabe Tei (a seafood udon) also seemed to fall short of expectation. If you are so inclined, check them out for your self.
author: Caesar A.

description: Yup, that's about right, Meh! is what I would describe this place. I've been here a couple of times, hoping for a genuine Japanese cuisine experience but left disappointed. Did I really just pay for sub-par food for premium prices? Yes, I did. It's in the heart of Japan town mall so my expectations were very high. First visit was out of curiosity and the next one was with family. Sadly, I feel like my local L&L hawaiian spot makes better Katsu and ramen than they do. :(
author: Diana B.

description:
Tourist trap. !!!!!!!!
It looks like it's authentic Japanese restaurant from out side. What a mistake it was.  
Food looks like it was just thrown.  Eel nigiri was served cold.  Shrimp and tamago were store bought. 
It turn out to be one time visit rip off place for the tourists.
author: Chum C.

description:
This place holds great memories for me but asides from that, it isn't a good place to eat at.

A few days ago, my boyfriend and I came into this establishment to eat lunch. 

Upon entering, we were greeted, seated, and given two glasses of water. Afterwards we were given menus and we both picked the lunch set meals.

He chose the tonkatsu ramen with california roll while I chose the zaru soba with tuna over rice bowl.

We waited for about ten minutes before getting our food.

Food was average, really not worth the price. 
Tuna was rubbery and definitely tasted like it was defrosted ten minutes before being served to me. 
The zaru soba was fine, but then again how hard is it to boil noodles? 
The ramen was meh, it didn't pack much flavor. Had better ramen in Alameda than here.
The california roll was the only thing my boyfriend liked, but then again he likes anything with mayo in it. 
The quality really went downhill since I last arrived here seven years ago.

Would totally not recommend this place to anyone. There are other places in Japantown to eat at which serves similar food items as this establishment.
author: Trinity S.

description:
Sorry but what the hell. I should've checked yelp first. Two stars?! Really. I finished my food before some of the dishes came out. I'm a fairly slow eater compared to my party. A few of us ate a few bite and stopped for a while, and ate again... AND THEY STILL FINISHED BEFORE THE LAST TWO DISHES CAME OUT. Are you kidding me?! When we tried to flag down a waiters/waitresses, they blatantly ignored us. Multiple waiters/waitresses ignored us. The food is just meh, definitely not worth the wait. It's not even worth talking about. 

If you're hungry, just go fill yourself up with some crepes. You're good to go.
author: Stacy C.

description:
Food is good for the price! Wait time is about 15 minutes, if they're busy you write your name on the whiteboard that they have as soon as you enter the place. 15 minute wait plus you get an attitude from the waitresses asking you 3 times if you've written your name on their board. The food is worth all these though! 

Ramen (Miso w/ corn) - 8/10 tasty and I don't know what it is but I like their noodles, there's something about it that is addicting lol 

Takoyaki - 6/10 mehhh. It's too tiny. Seriously, Quickly's version is better.. much bigger 


Sushi rolls - 7/10 few selection


Place - 8/10 I can bring my tinder date here. LOL 


Price - 8/10 typically ramen 10-13$ sushi rolls 10-13$ takoyaki is $5 for 6 TINY pieces 


Service - 6/10
author: Maria Mekaela C.

description: Meh. So meh. The seaweed on our sushi was stale, and the salmon was warm. The donburi was dry and had way too much rice. Service was borderline rude. Do not recommend at all.
author: H L.

description:
The food was pretty good - the curry especially - but the service was lacking. Rude wait staff who messed up our order and didn't even apologize. My wife ordered unagi and they brought her a beef bowl. When we returned it and said that we orders unagj the girl said they ran out (we were there five mins after opening!) and to choose something else. So what...they thought they'd substitute and alwe wouldn't notice??? 
The icing on the cake was the bill. They added in a 15% tip for a party of four and it came out to $98.74. We left a $100 and I would have left the $1.26 regardless, but they didn't even bring the change back to me! How PRESUMPTUOUS.
author: Donn M.

description: We should have checked the rating before we entered. This is a below average Japanese restaurant and they truly deserve a low rating. The tonkatsu ramen was acceptable. The soup was a little too salty and not much flavor to it. For the curry rice, the rice tasted like those sat in the fridge for too long and got dried out. The curry was alright. The seats were kind of smell.
author: derek c.

description: I ordered the Niku Donburi and after taking one small bite I knew the rice was extremely old. It smelled and tasted like it was sitting out for weeks in a damp pot. There wasn't very much beef either. My friend, who had Tonkotsu ramen, didn't enjoy it either, noting how bland the flavors were and how little to no preparation was put it into it. I wanted to exhange/return it for a new order but the waitress said I couldn't do anything about it and I had to pay full price even when I refused to eat it. There is so much disregard and disrespect for food and customers in this place. They don't care about your dining experience. The cooks/chef have absolutely NO respect for Japanese food. Please avoid this place.
author: Gerald B.

description: everything seemed to be frozen and thrown in a deep fryer. also shrimp in my udon was DEF 100% frozen because they were tiny and watered down the broth tremendously.
author: Nature F.

description:
Basic service!
Basic food!
Basic price!
Not to be rude, but the food was mediocre, their sauce was gross, and they gave me mostly rice. For 15 dollars? They can keep it. My friend got a basic rainbow roll and four (4) salmon rolls and it was 19 dollars? No thank you! There are plenty of other eating places I would suggest you find one. It's getting two stars because I liked hanging out with my best friend so I'm being generous.
author: Savannah C.

description:
This used to be one of my favorite quick bite places in Japantown, Mifune. Saw that it changed hands, decided to give it a try.  To start, the floor was sticky. For me, that is always a turn off and makes me concerned about overall cleanliness. But I can overlook alot of things when the food is good.  

The food was bland, on the expensive side and generally uninspired.  The udon tasted like those plastic packages you can buy at Asian groceries stores for a few bucks with a few extra ingredients tossed in. The oyako donburi was also very bland and the chicken had lots of cartilage. My friend's ramen was bland and salty. The California roll that came with it (lunch special) was fine. She said she would not order again. So we were 3 for 3 and it wasn't inexpensive either ($9-$13.95 per person).  

The workers were around the age of college students and they literally just slammed down the plates and left, never to return. I had to flag one down for the  menus, and then when we were done, had to flag another down for the bill.

There are lots of options in  Japantown,  this isn't a very good example of Japanese food and the perfunctory service makes it even less appealing.
author: S. D.

description:
It's been atleast 6 months since I came to this location in Jtown and apparently it is now Nandeya (new ownership). Thought we'd give it a try since we were already here..

Big mistake. The staff seemed consistently straight faced and business minded only. We got the cha su ramen, which was way below par for SF ramen standards, and the katsu curry. The katsu was tough and lacking flavor.

What really got me upset was we ordered wau wau roll and it had a foul taste to it. We complained and said the fish was not fresh. "Sorry everyone gets the same fish".

They did not offer to take it off the check or offer a substitute. We will NOT be coming back EVER!!!
author: Bebe W.

description:
The food isn't bad. It's the service. I came here with two of my girlfriends on Thursday night and it wasn't busy by any means - in fact it was slowing down. 

And it took forever to get anything done here. The biggest gripe was my two girl friends got their food and I was just waiting for mine. I get things happen in the kitchen but at least let me know. I know you saw me looking and turning back to see what that the status of my dish was but you choose to ignore it and not say anything. 

sigh. 

In terms of food, again, it's not bad. We all ordered some form of soup noodles (udon). I ordered the sukiyaki nabe tei while my friend just ordered the sukiyaki nabe. The only really differences are - bigger bowl and side of rice. -_-
author: Stephanie W.

description: We know has two star but still try to be adventurous to give it a try. Kind of want to know how bad it could be. LOL Well they total blow us away how terrible they can do. The food is dry and amateur. The food from nearby Japanese supermarket is way better.
author: Ben C.

description:
Slow service .... I didn't like the previous place and thought I would try the new owners. They need to pick up the pace and be more attentive to customer.
Food is just ok. Nothing to write home about and I won't come back.
author: Alison W.

description: I loved their price for the lunch menu. They had awesome sushi and amazing tempura. It was a little busy while we were there but the waitress was still attentive. I would definitely go back if I was here longer.
author: Allysa R.

description:
I've been to this place on several occasions and while never mind blowing, it was decent enough to eat at in a pinch.  However, we're striking this place completely off our list.  

On today's visit, I ordered their lunch special consisting of an entrée and a smaller side.  I opted for the tonkotsu ramen and potstickers.  Sounds yummy doesn't it?  Boy was I disappointed!  I'm a big fan of potstickers, but I can't for the life of me eat tempura.  And these potstickers were covered in tempura.  I asked the waitress if I could exchange the potstickers for something else.  She said "ok."  A few minutes later she said an exchange was not possible because there were pictures of what I ordered on the menu.  That of course would have been a perfectly acceptable explanation but-for the fact that the menu misrepresented the potstickers.  To boot, my ramen was extraordinarily salty and it took our waitress a good 10 minutes to bring us a glass of water even though people seated after us got their drinks before us.  So in short:

Tempura potstickers + Salty ramen + Poor customer service = A few less customers

On a happier note, since I didn't eat much, I visited Belly Good Café & Crepes and indulged in one of their crepes which instantly made me much happier!
author: R Q.

description:
Omg worst food i never had... can't believe they serve packaging ochazuke for over $6.00.
Never going back ever again.
author: Sarah L.

description:
The worst restaurant in Japan Town, don't even think about it. 
We went in the restaurant and sit in for about 15 minutes, nobody came to serve us.

For a simply lunch, try Osayaka next door, you won't be disappointed.
author: Furby W.

description:
DO NOT GO
I would give a 0 star if I can. Not to say how bad the food is, the material are not fresh at all, they taste like they have been frozen for a month. Then, look out to your RECEIPT. They tipped themselves on my bill without my permission. And that was 18% of my spending. WTH? That's stealing money from the customer, don't you know that, dear owner!!!! I have never seen anything like that before. But no wonder why their rating is so low.
author: Franco Z.

description: This is one of the many restaurants located inside Japantown. We where greeted and seated within seconds and given water. We looked at the menu an within a couple of minutes we where taken our order. They delivered our drinks fast an waited about 5 to 10 min for our food to come out. The portions where a good size not too big nor too small. The place is very affordable as well! The food taste freshly made an not over seasoned. Just right! My favorite was the goyza / potstickers you have to try them! The only down size is that the place is small so it does feel a bit crowded.
author: Iveth R.

description:
I'd rather have Mifune.  Friend was craving a late lunch of ramen, and this happened to be the first place we passed by. I wanted to try the tonkotsu ramen, but when I asked the waitress if it contained any dairy (because I have allergies) her response was that she didn't know, and I should get the mis- no the shoyu ramen instead. Uh. なんでやねん？！？！  I'm no waitress, but I thought standard response to queries like that was "i'm not sure, but let me check with the chef." After a brief internal debate of whether to ask her to check with the kitchen, order nothing, order something else entirely or suck it up and order the shoyu ramen, I decided to order the shoyu one.  It wasn't what I wanted, was mediocre at best, and I have no plans to come back.  

There are lots of little hand-drawn advertisements for appetizers/ side dishes at the booths, but I have no idea what any of them costs because of course they didn't add the prices.  I might've tried something to ease my disappointment over the ramen if I'd known how much they cost.

Service was prompt, but we also walked in after 3:00 and the lunch rush.

Nandeyanen Nande-Ya.
author: Kelsey W.

description:
Generic Japanese food of no distinction, with the unagi being a sad rendition.

I only came here out of nostalgia for Mifune, which had been here recently.

Although the Kintetsu Mall seems to be thriving, the businesses are now less Japanese than Korean or Taiwanese. That in itself is not bad. It is just that the best places in this mall were always the remnants of those owned by actual Japanese families in the old Japantown. Such is the case no longer.
author: George T.

description: This used to be a staple place for me when I lived in SF. Japan Town is always pleasant to visit for that nostalgic feeling when I lived in Japan. I admit Nande-ya is not the best Japanese food. Heck, I would say that most Japanese restaurants in US would not compare to the genuine thing you would find in Japan. However, Nande-ya is convenient and easily accessible to SF dwellers. It is one of the bigger restaurants in the Japan Town, which means less wait time. They also have almost everything you would order in a Japanese restaurant: different types of don, nabe, tempura, sushi, soba, udon etc. This makes it very easy to satisfy all types of cuisine seekers and the different taste of your friends. Price is also quite reasonable at ~$16 per dish. I would recommend Nan-de ya for a quick and fairly decent Japanese meal when you visit Japan Town. Curry with or without tonkatsu is especially my favorite.
author: Sam K.

description:
Changed ownership..omg
This rest was used to be mifune; one of my favorite rest in the japan town. Pretty good udon noodle soup.
But today I found out it was different owner and different chef.
We ordered dinner special for tonkatsu, tempura and tempura with cold soba.
All of them were tasteless.
I was disappointed so much.
Save your money from this rest.
Will not go back; felt wasted my time and money.
author: Jane K.

description: Not bad, but not great. My friend and I ordered the Wau Wau sushi roll, curry chicken katsu, and a dinner bento box set with sashimi and mixed tempura. Out of the three, the sushi roll tasted the best. I didn't eat any of the sashimi but the color of it was a little off. The curry looked appetizing but it was served lukewarm and lacked flavor. It was one-dimensional... definitely needed a little bit more salt or something. Unfortunately, tempura wasn't memorable. The coating wasn't crunchy! I don't remember the dipping sauce being any good either. Though the meal wasn't my favorite, the service and ambiance was a-ok.
author: Annie S.

description: Their food.. the katsu is fried too much. The noodles are not good... but their service is perfect though. Like their waitress not the chef!
author: Gigi L.

description:
for the first time... yelp has failed me. 

we read the reviews after we sat down and based on how poorly this place was rated i was ready to get up and leave. i decided to tough it out and try it for myself and all the reviews i read were pretty wrong. it wasn't salty or bad like everyone else has said but it wasn't the greatest either though.

my only complaint is it's kinda cramped and the service isn't good.

if i could give it 3.5 stars, i would
author: Jon P.

description:
IM LIVID!!!!!!!!!! Don't get me wrong the food was great! We ordered a lot!! Udon, gyoza, French fries for the kids.. sushi roll!! Like come on now the service was not on point.. they the 2gals working never came back and offered water! Didn't check to see how we were doing! Didn't ask if we needed anything else.. I asked for more spices and she didn't understand what o was asking for! 

What tops it off was we paid partial cash and rest on cards and I tipped on the table!! NEVER HAVE I BEEN CHASED OUTSIDE THE DOOR FOR TIP 2x!!! When I had already explained I left tip on the table! I tipped according to service! I'm in the service industry and this has never happened to me! I definitely won't be coming back here I thought hey why not give it a try although they have 2STARS why not!! Never again!
author: Emm F.

description:
Terrible. Terrible. Terrible. 
That's all I really have to say. 
Why we stopped in here for an early dinner when visiting Japan Town I will never understand. Of-cause my mistake not checking it out first here on Yelp. They have only 2 stars. That should have been enough of a warning sign not to go. 
No reason to tear them apart in a silly review. This place is simply just terrible. 

Hugs.
author: Othelia J.

description: I ordered the lunch special teriyaki chicken with gyoza. The teriyaki sauce looked like a chicken covered with gelatin. The service was horrible. The staff looked like she didn't like her job bussing tables and when it was time for the tip, jeez, it was like there was a sudden change of personality. I don't think I'm going back. Not worth the money. I learned from this restaurant is to check reviews before I dine in.
author: Kat P.

description: My girlfriend and I wanted to try a different place than our usual spots in Japantown and came here. It looked populated and a good selection of food. The server was nice and accommodated a mistake in ordering on my part. I had the chashu ramen and my girlfriend got the Ebi Toji and I ordered the Wau Wau roll for us to share. The ramen was salty and the food was just disappointing. The roll was the same but it did have a lot of fish in it. They brought the wrong order for my girlfriend which had chicken in it. I would not come back again.
author: Michael L.

description:
Came here and didn't realize that the place changed from Mifune. Ordered a lunch special of tonkatsu ramen and tekka don for about $14 and... the ramen came with one super thin slice of pork, some ramen noodles, small slices of bamboo and bean sprouts. The noodles were clumpy. I expected another slice of meat, an egg, etc. 

Tekka don was ok-the slice of sashimi were of decent size, but meal overall was not worth it for $14+tax/tip
author: Kimberly W.

description:
I'm writing this review from the perspective of someone who owned (including actually cooking) a Japanese restaurant for 15 years.

I really wanted to like this place. It is in the same spot as a place we used to eat whenever we were in Japantown. When I saw that it had only 19 reviews I assumed ownership was new. Most of the reviews focused on the lack of speedy service. I was willing to give it a try because it was only 5:30pm on a Saturday and they weren't too busy yet (they were completely filled by the time we were left.)

My wife ordered the Tenzaru Soba, I had the Teriyaki Chicken dinner, and my son ordered the adult size Tempura Udon. We also split the Mt. Fuji sushi roll. All of their dishes leave something to be desired with plating. The tempura for both dishes was just strewn about the plates.

The soba noodles were spread out across the tray rather than neatly piled into a mound. My wife said the food was good, but I think thats just because I asked in front of our son. I thought the tempura was doughy rather than crispy. I also found the sauce bland and watery.

The teriyaki chicken was grilled dark meat chicken. It was a pile of random bits and pieces rather than nice thigh filets that I'm used too. They grilled the chicken bits then drizzled sauce over it (you could actually tell the bits were grilled vs. grilled thigh filets that were cut afterwards). The sauce was bland and it had no flavor. It was too watery and didn't stick to the chicken. The miso soup served with the soup was too salty. The salad was simply iceberg lettuce, a couple sliced cucumbers, and a slice of tomato with a miso like dressing. The dressing was good. For $16.50 I expected a lot more wow. Even in the city, this was steep in my opinion.

The tempura udon for my son was barely enough for him to leave full. There could have been more noodles for the price, and, I don't believe they were cooked fresh. The soup was also bland and lack any flavor. It was a plain udon with two slices of kamaboko and sliced green onions in it. It would have had more flavor and it would have been more filling if it had some vegetables and garnishes in it. Again, the tempura dipping sauce was bland. It also had too much daikon in it to enable any dipping.

The Mt. Fuji roll was the only thing I enjoyed. I couldn't place the flavor of the sauces on top. The price was right for the ingredients. The plating was actually fine compared to another picture posted of the same roll.

This restaurant needs some recipe work.

Oh, and the service indeed was lacking. We were seated almost immediately; however it took about 10 minutes before a waiter came over to take our order. They provided a carafe of room temperature water. Obviously, this was so they didn't have to check back often. After delivering our food (only took about 15 minutes), we never saw them again until we were 3/4 finished and we needed some more tempura sauce. It took 5 minutes just to flag them down to ask for the sauce because they never looked in our direction. They were too focused on wherever they were headed. They only had 3 waiters working. They needed 5 probably for good service.
author: Michael W.

description:
Foods eh, but several service mishaps dropped the rating another star. A table seated after our party of 2 had their order taken and received their food prior to us. When our entrees arrived they were separated by about 10 mins so one of us stared over their food at the other for an uncomfortable period of time with no explanation, and when the second entree did arrive it almost went to the table next to ours (we had to claim it). 

The upside is that there wasn't much of a wait.
author: Brian S.

description: Pretty good. Not sure why reviews are so low BUT I was very hungry. Try the lite NCHRA special.
author: Gordon B.

description:
MICE!!! Super dirty. Saw a mouse run under our table during dinner. Had a dead roach squished on the edge of the to-go box.

POOR SERVICE. Asked us to pay and rushed us when we had just started eating.

Over priced, mid quality food. Came for dinner.
author: Raph T.

description: Not satisfied at all. The water they served was warm.  Cups they had were plastic and seemed dirty. It felt weird drinking warm water in their dirty cups. The food we ordered was the worst. It was very pricey for fish that wasn't even fresh. Will never eat here again.
author: Leanna C.

description: This is the location on the top floor where Mifuni used to be for decades. Mifune's quality went downhill as they had new mgmt. Then i noticed a name change when i was there the other day. I ordered a $13.99 lunch special combo, a bowl of ramen and Calif roll. I came at around 3pm so it was not during the lunch rush. The ramen came in a small bowl that was inverted to slant down so bottom is very narrow and as you go to the top it widens. Noodles are cheap at cost, so no need to be stingy. The broth seemed fine, albeit a little salty for my taste. Would be nice to have a little bit more veggies in it.
author: Tiffany W.

description: I ordered the $13.25 lunch special which comes with an entree and a smaller version of a big entree. My big entree was a tonkatsu ramen and my smaller fish was an unagi rice bowl. They both weren't bad, but just a high sodium meal I chose. The tonkatsu ramen had a lot of red ginger in it that soaked into the noodles and soup and I do not like ginger, but I asked if they could add more soup to dilute it and they made that adjustment for me. That's why I'm giving four stars because of the service. The unagi was okay, but the rice was a little dry so it was just a bad batch of rice. This is my first time here, but I'll be back to see if the restaurant is two stars in my eyes.
author: Justina J.

description: Ohh this place is just not good at all. Udon not only bland but tastes in general off... Rice bowls are covered in vinegar with bland sour cold rice. In general, rushed, unauthentic meal. Don't recommend.
author: Roxanne A.

description:
Plus 1 has working AC during 100 heat wave in SF. Many other place we checked did not in Japan town.

3 stars for decent food. Baby liked the bullet train. Sansa ramen was unique and curry rice (part of combo) was good. I liked my spicy tuna roll, actually spicy!

Service was above average. We will go back again soon.
author: Tom H.

description: $13.5 for this lunch special with udon and unagi don. Food was pretty good, the Niku in udon is a bit tough but soup is good. Unagi is on point. Service was fast as I went during lunch on a Tuesday. Would come back for these lunch deals.
author: Stephanie T.

description: Looking for a quick bite while exploring Japantown. Service quick and food tasty. Clean and pleasant. Straightforward "street food" with ramen and sushi.
author: Marla S.

description: I got the temptoji donburi. The batter part didn't stick to the vegetable/shrimp and the vegetables were soggy and gross inside. The egg wasn't very appetizing either. Would not recommend.
author: Carolyn T.

description: First time I had cam here since my daughters wanted ramen.  We ordered the tonkatsu ramen, California roll, and fried potsticker combos that was around 13.95.  May I say that I eat very salty foods which is not a good thing, but the soup in the ramen was mouth numbing salty for me which tells you that it is even beyond my taste buds.  Most ramen includes half an egg which this place did not have. The cha-su/pork was overcooked and a little tough when it should melt in your mouth.  There was quite a lot of bamboo shoots and bean sprouts in the soup. The California rolls were good which is for the two stars.  Potstickers contained too much batter.  Service was not the best as they missed one of our orders,  and it took a while to get someone's attention.
author: FG L.

description: There is no sugar coating way to say this: The ramen smells like piss. Please do not get ramen here. I lost my appetite, and couldn't try stomaching it because of the smell. And when I did try it, the broth was very salty. It was worse than instant ramen.
author: Rae A.

description: We came in at lunch time. They were quite busy. The unagi don was delicious. The servers were very accommodating. I would definitely come back.
author: Altaïr I.

description: After eating a ton over overpriced fake disappointing Japanese food in San Francisco, I was delighted to find a regular Japanese restaurant with authentic flavors and atmosphere at a reasonable price point. I was born in Japan btw ;). Not sure what the poor reviews are about. It's not fancy but it's one of the best tasting places around for the price. Even the name is a cute Japanese play on words. I'd recommend and def go back. It's a lot better than Izakaya Kou, Waraku and all these other places that try to be fancy but really aren't that great. Even Hinodeya with their $15 ramen is just OK. You can get amazing ramen in Japan for $7.
author: Uriae W.

description: Meh. My favorite ramen place was closed so I decided to give it a try. Don't waste your time. The ramen was ok. I had a lot left and asked for a little broth to go an they said they couldn't do that. Really? You can't scoop it into a container and charge me $1? Not a huge surprise, but more reason why you shouldn't waste your time. We also ordered gyoza and a seaweed salad. Everything was medicocre
author: Alison P.

description:
NOPE and NOPE. 

10-15 minute wait after we sat down until we saw a waitress. 

20 minute wait for our food. 

We watch the food runner bring our order to the table next to us. 
We watch one of the guys take a bite. 
We watch the waitress come back and try to figure out where OUR food went. She takes it from him. Goes back to the kitchen. 

2 minutes later she brings the bowl out to our table claiming it's a new dish. 

We say NOPE. She says sorry, it's busy - half the place was empty. 

We pay the bill for our beers and walk out. 

30 minutes of NOPE... and never again.
author: Meredith O.

description:
Absolutely ridiculous horrendous service. 15 min after almost everyone got their meal, two plates still weren't served and it turned out waitress didn't even have the right orders for those two, let alone not having what she originally wrote in. 

Food for them came in 15 min after when everyone else finished even after slowly eating in hopes the last two would get their food in time and I hear they ran out of fries as they bring In the dishes (thanks for the courtesy of not telling us). No apologies and no comp.  Also great that when I tried checking in, one waitress shouted across the restaurant that it was coming. 

Otherwise, food was average, though katsu was overcooked. Food might be Japanese, but the service sure as hell isn't.
author: M Y.

description: I got a gigantic bowl of beef nabe for $16. It was absolutely delicious. Service was fast.
author: Bob C.

description: Worst service EVER. Not sure these people are function with brains. We could see (overhear) that single table around us had issues. STAY AWAY!
author: L. M.

description: Nabeyaki came with no rice or dipping sauce as stated on menu.  Sliver of shrimp with thick coating if tempura. No umami factor. I don't like al dente udon noodles either.
author: El T.

description: Ramen has no eggs and only one piece of chasu... Seriously? It's just ironic that such a restaurant opens in SF JAPAN TOWN.
author: Xuan M.

description:
TLDR: This place is alright. 

For the price, it's on the more expensive side since we were not full after eating the meal. Their dishes have considerably more rice than other Japanese restaurants I've eaten at. The sashimi we ordered was cut unevenly. The ramen I got was just your average broth and noodles with the noodles being on the softer side. I like my noodles chewy, but that's a personal preference. 

I'd only come here if the other places are full or maybe not.
author: Steven Y.

description: I made the mistake of coming here without checking the yelp reviews. I ordered the beef curry here. It was overall okay but the portion size for the curry is very small. They serve it flat on a shallow plate, which was not very filling at all. I ordered a miso ramen afterwards because I was still hungry. It was good, but uninspired. Food: 3 stars. -1 star for portion size
author: Bill C.

description: I ordered a shabu beef udon today and I am spending almost twenty dollars for 5 little pieces of beef cooked in hot soup. The udon that I brought from grocery store costed only 99 cents tasted even better than the udon at this place. The soup is unflavored. I am still feeling hungry after having this beef udon costed twenty dollars. Wow! Ridiculous. Of course never be back!
author: Jessica Y.

description: Maybe they read the reviews because our group of 9 was seated within a couple minutes of arriving and our orders were taken as soon as we were ready. Water came swiftly, as did the food that we ordered. The waiters checked regularly without interrupting the table. Good service, good portions and reasonable pricing. I would consider this place again.
author: Sean M.

description:
How do you not have green tea in a Japanese restaurant in Japantown??!!
Food is horrible. Took two bites and I was done. Find somewhere else, anywhere else but here.  Walk around and wait for that restaurant to open at 5.
author: Christina C.

description: Not worth it. Less to no service. Worst choice to make coming in here on a cold rainy day. Food was salty and bad. Everything about this place is just bad. Not much to choose from and the restaurant itself doesn't look appealing.  Had no idea why I would even step in.
author: Mei Z.

description: I am not sure this place has changed the owner but this is my first time here if so and the decoration doesn't change much. There are 3 dishes were appealing to me: Beef curry udon, temptiji Donburi (tempura and egg over rice), and beef and unagi Donburi (beef and eel over rice). But I end up getting beef and unagi Donburi. I think my rice bowl taste good. The beef is soft and very tender, with the slightly sweet sauce, while the eel is firm and fresh but the eel flavor goes well with the beef. I came on Thursday night and there was no line, but I'm not sure how long is the line during weekend lunch.
author: Jacques S.

description: Today we had the curry katsu, Cali roll, miso ramen, tempura dinner and nabe sukiyaki. I'm gonna keep it short and simple. The food is just meh, but the service was terrible. At one point our waitress was running away from our table when asking for hot tea. We were also told that we would be charged more for the California roll because the ramen +Cali roll special didn't include miso ramen. (Nowhere does it say what ramen you can have, but miso ramen is the cheapest ramen in the menu, it would just be good business sense to include it) instead they tried to push katsu ramen with the Cali roll. Lastly, skip the nabe sukiyaki. It doesn't taste anything like sukiyaki....you'd just be setting yourself up for failure. Do yourself a favor and pick any other restaurant in the j-town center.
author: Joseph C.

description:
We ate here before trying Ebisu and was in the area doing the whole tourist thing.

There were several people eating there and it made me think their food was good.  It was the opposite.

The service we received here wasn't worth the mandatory tip that was included on our bill.  
It seems like because they were guaranteed a tip, they can be lax and not give good service.  It was difficult to ask for refills as well as to get carry out containers.

We ordered different items from their menu like ramen (the instant tonkotsu noodles are better and not as salty), sushi, donburi (was missing the sauce), tempura (oily) and curry.  We've tasted better from Mitsuwa food court.  

If we ever find ourselves in this vicinity, we're going to steer clear of this establishment.
author: C O.

description:
Completely terrible. I've been going to Japantown for years and I usually go to Mifune Don (East Mall) all the time because Im a regular there but it was closed for an hour or so but me and my girlfriend was hungry so we decided to go to a different restaurant. Literally, when I tell you that I had the worst time there ever. I HAD THE ABSOLUTE WORST TIME. Outside the restaurant there were specials displayed like ramen and Cali rolls which is my general combo that I would pay separately but this restaurant had a combo so I thought I'd give it a try. When we sat down, the waitresses were mean and had a straight face the whole time. They asked if we wanted anything yet and as soon as we were going to speak they would say "oh I'll come back later." Finally when we ordered, I asked if the bowl of ramen has the option of spicy or if it had fish cakes in there (which was on the display outside) and they said "no, put your own spice". And I said, "okay, I guess". So we tried our ramen. The pork was hard, the shrimp were tough and the California rolls look like they've been sitting there for a while. The broth was disgusting! We took two bites and was over the food so we asked if we could pay for the things we did eat and how we didn't like the other. The waitress literally said "oh sorry, here's your bill" didn't offer us another option, nothing. They called the manager over and she was just as rude. Making rude comments like "I bet you do this all the time" "you're just trying to dine and dash" but we literally was willing to pay just not for what was gross. I almost threw up but they did not care whatsoever. Then some other guy came and got in our face saying yelling at us about how that's how restaurants are. I was completely done. But wait. That's not even all. They called security and made a big seen and claimed that we were trying to dine and dash but we never even left. It went all the way to sfpd just for them to give us just a discount. 

I wasted time and money there and didn't even get to eat. 

Absolutely terrible. LIKE NEVER EVER GO THERE. WORST RESTAURANT IN JAPANTOWN.
author: Rei K.
