description: Rude customer service and  unprofessional servers. Please be kind and be  professional. Don't be Nasty rude. Oh yeah stop digging your nasty nose front for the customers. Never come  back again disgusting.
author: Yoki P.

description: Food was good. The service was TERRIBLE!!! We had to ask for water multiple times. It's really bad when I have to get up to ask them for stuff. It was well staffed and there were only 2 other tables at the restaurant. She gave us our check when we were still eating and when she got our money she said "no change right?" Really?! Yes, we need our change back. I should've gone with my first instinct and went to the restaurant next door.
author: E F.

description: Service was hodge podge , beer was delivered long after food. Cooked food came before sushi. Rice tasted old, fish was bland, edamame was tasteless. Service was absent, had to track them down from r missing part I order.
author: Matthew A.

description: We eat here today. I order breaded pork with curry and rice. The servings is ok but the salad on the side is NOT Fresh.  Tomato and lettuce is old. Def not coming back
author: Lyka J.

description: Absolutely horrible.    Japantown has a lot of good food and I've been here before but now that's it's under new management, it's not that good.  The food was too salty and the servers were rude and clueless.   We ordered from the menu both verbally (told them what we wanted) and visually (pointed at the menu) and we still had to repeat it three times.   We waited about 30 minutes for the first plate to arrive and the others came in 10 minute increments.  We waited about an hr and 6 out of 8 plates that we ordered arrived.   We asked about the other two plates and apparently it was not placed.  The food isn't good, price is high, wait is too long, and service is horrible.  Definitely do yourself a favor and avoid this place.
author: Kevin L.

description: Ramen is sub-par when comparing to other places in japan town. I paid 13.75 for bowl tonkatsu ramen and a side of CA rolls which is their lunch special. So I paid for a $8-9 ramen and they only gave me and my friend one piece of pork . $4-5 ramen for $8-9 os a no bueno.
author: Andrew A.

description: This restaurant is not good at all. The chicken udon was undercooked and the the noodles were too thick and eggy. The CA rolls were also bad. The rice was hard. Also, the water taste like sink water. Finally, the waiters were judgmental, and looked "disappointed."
author: Fatimah A.

description: I came here last night to grab a two to-go orders. I've been to this restaurant before (a few months ago), and I have to say that the food was not as bad as it seemed to be (per the cheap-looking menu), which is why I decided to come back again last night. It's not the greatest Japanese food, but for the price, it's decent and pretty good. I recommend their sukiyaki and their beef yakiniku. Hope their large serving of sukiyaki keeps up. You just can't get it to-go though. Service is good but the problem I am writing about is in how they forgot to hand me a part of the tempura dinner set I ordered. It came with a side of California rolls, but that was not included. I called the number listed on their receipt: "Tel: 415-922-0337" but was led to a voicemail message which was of a lady speaking in French! I don't know what place that was, but that certainly doesn't sound like it's this Japanese restaurant at all. The number "(628) 444-3580" listed on Google, doesn't work either, and only leads you to a voicemail box. I decided to just course the problem through my credit card company to compensate me for the missing order. Other than that, the restaurant is tiny, so, if you're not too uncomfortable about the thought of having the people seated at the tables next to you hear your chatter, then the seating arrangements should not bother you. If it does, either don't talk at all or just eat here by yourself (or, get your food to-go).
author: Samantha A.

description: It is an okay place for a quick meal. It doesn't differentiate itself much from other restaurants in Japan Town. Service was okay and the food tasted decent. Wouldn't mind visiting this place again.
author: Sydney C.

description:
ordered the ramen and ca roll lunch special 

ramen looked horrible and tasted bad too

noodles were sooo tough and tasted and looked microwaved. the ramen had NO FLAVOR. i had to drown it in soy sauce to make it even somewhat taste good. the piece of pork that comes in it tasted like porkchop it was so tough and gross. i mean yes ive lived in japan for 4years and can be a bit spoiled but this isnt nowhere near good. next time ill go get some top ramen and eat it
author: Pierre L.

description: When this location was Mifune's, I was here all the time for a fast and tasty meal.  Nande-Ya has neither.  I was seated immediately but it took at least ten minutes for a server to make it to my table. I ordered the lunch special of niku-udon and gyoza.  After a long wait, the food came. The gyoza was accompanied by a very small and shallow dish with a bit of dipping sauce, but not enough for six dumplings. I like my gyoza with hot oil and rice vinegar but just try to get a server to come back to your table.  The niku was tasteless. They didn't bother to brown the beef before they put it in the soup.  Meh.  When the bill came they charged me for ala carte instead of the special. It took another long time for them to figure out how to fix that.  In the end I paid the bill and for perhaps the first time in my life, I did not tip. At all. I won't be back.
author: Dirk B.

description:
This is the former location of Mifune which recently closed. I was so disappointed the last time I came to Japantown and saw that MIFUNE is no longer! I have been coming to Mifune for 26 years! They still have a location in Japantown downstairs but it's not the same. I'm curious to know why such an established restaurant would up and leave?
 Today I was in Japantown and decided to try the restaurant that is now in their location Nande-Ya. It´s the same lay out, I always liked the little booths for one towards the back. The menu was one sheet of paper, I did a quick look and was happy to see they kept my favorite meal Tanin Soba (thin buckwheat noodles with egg and beef) also ordered 1 shrimp tempura and croquettes. The meal looked familiar but the broth in the soup wasn't quite the same as I remember at Mifune but my taste has been off for a few days (winter allergies). It was good. Prices are reasonable, I will come back.
author: David P.

description: I dont know why this place was rated so low but our group was seated after 5 minutes of waiting. The food took a little longer but no biggie because the food was amazing. I had the udon and curry lunch combo (nice price for a lot of food). The eel was also pretty yummy. Overall neat restuarant to get a good meal for a decent price.
author: Eileen T.

description: It's a great place to eat in the Japanese center. The service was great, it was an old man, but he greeted us with a smile and replenished our water without asking. He also asked if we wanted free hot tea which was really nice. I don't know who  the other reviewers had as their server but ours was amazing. The food was amazing too, I recommend the takoyaki, ramen, curry udon, and Shabu. The price is moderate, but they have great portions. Avg dish price is about $10-$15. For my party of 5, our total was about $70 before tax. All in all, great place and it should deserve more credit and stars!
author: Carissa Y.

description: Not good. Food is super salty and taste like packet seasoning. Udon is undercooked. Seafood ramen isn't terrible. If you want decent Japanese food, go elsewhere.
author: Glenn R.

description: we came here looking for decent udon. my kids had the chicken and I had the beef. delicious! great broth and chewy noodles!
author: Ho N.

description: Food doesn't taste good and doesn't satisfy your cravings. Not sure if it was the long line or what, but it certainly did not make me happy about eating here.
author: Carrie T.

description: This Nande ya resturant was the worst in J-Town. Food was Cold and Tea tasted like water. Staff was very Rude. The whole experience was terrible!!! Did not leave a tip.I don't know how they stay open. Very Bad place.
author: John O.

description: I left this place feeling full... of disappointment! The service was decent, and the place is cute, but the food is really sub par.
author: Grant E.

description: It is difficult not to compare this place to Mifune which operated until recently in the same space. Mifune was there for decades and I really wish it was still there. Nande-Ya did a little sprucing up of the space. And I do mean a little. It looks like the painters left the job site without finishing. One half of the room was dark and blocked off which was strange. This place is operating on a shoe string. The room is decorated, if you want to call it that, with signs in Japanese advertising food and drink items. Since I don't read Japanese I guess I am not their target market. The menus are printed on office paper and are badly wrinkled and stained, not a good sign. I kept wondering how many hands had touched them. I had udon which was WAY too salty and lacked any depth of flavor. They didn't have avocado so they couldn't make California Roll for me. No avocado???!!!  Service was slow and disorganized. I don't think this place is going to make it. I won't be going back.
author: Lee D.

description: Great food, seated immediately 8am on Saturday night, took our orders quickly, food was fantastic had the udon and tempura and sake, waitress checked in on us to make sure we were okay. Only gripe was that the walls and tables were not clean. Same chef as mifune so expect the same food!!
author: Sydney L.

description: Ordered beef shabu, beef slices too thick and cooked well done, very tough. Soup too salty and sour. No service at all, waited 10min for tea, and more than 30min for the check...stilling sitting here like a fool, waiting for them to take my credit card.
author: Sean Z.

description: It's so sad when Japan town is now run by Chinese people. Might as well call it China Town Extension. This place was a lot better when it was Mifune. I mean Mifune wasn't great either but it felt authentic(kinda). But this is like complete down grade.
author: John A.

description: Nice staff, but worst donburi I've had. Soggy, floppy, tempura over mealy non-sushi rice. Plenty of good Japanese food nearby, I recommend skipping this place.
author: Simon P.
